tower_tr_01.name: Training Ground #7
tower_tr_01.desc: This training program is designed for Operators and command personnel participating in the Stationary Security Service, familiarizing them with the nature of the mission, and the differences from standard combat missions.

tower_tr_02.name: Training Ground #9
tower_tr_02.desc: This training program is designed for Operators and command personnel participating in the Stationary Security Service, familiarizing them with the nature of the mission, and the differences from standard combat missions.

tower_tr_03.name: Training Ground #10
tower_tr_03.desc: This training program is designed for Operators and command personnel participating in the Stationary Security Service, familiarizing them with the nature of the mission, and the differences from standard combat missions.

tower_n_01.name: Iron Carrot Mine
tower_n_01.desc: A mine in Rim Billiton on the periphery of Iron Carrot City's route, it was abandoned after accidentally digging into an Originium Slug nest. Recently, the Rim Billiton Mining Industry Association (RMIA) has decided to restart mining efforts here, and has outsourced guard duties to Rhodes Island due to a lack of manpower.

tower_n_02.name: Toron Mine
tower_n_02.desc: A property owned by Count Vincent of the County of Toron in Victoria, it is currently occupied by rioters after recent unrest in the area. The Count has contacted Rhodes Island through special channels, and hopes that they will be able to promptly restore working order to the Toron Mine.

tower_n_03.name: Glebe Mining Platform
tower_n_03.desc: A retired mobile mining platform owned by Rostov Industries, Ursus. Rostov Industries is planning to refurbish it and return it to service, and they have contracted Rhodes Island through Rosa to perform cleanup work.

tower_n_04.name: Słoma Processing Platform
tower_n_04.desc: Słoma Foods abandoned this food processing platform after an accident. The materials stored here have made it a nest for infected creatures and bandits, threatening nearby routes. The General Chamber of Commerce has demanded that Słoma deal with the issue, and the company has contracted Rhodes Island to clean the place up.

lt_tr_01.name: Training Ground #7
lt_tr_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>0
A training field specially built by Rhodes Island for the Security Drill, it simulates the mine area in a basic manner.

lt_tr_02.name: Training Ground #9
lt_tr_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>1
A training field specially built by Rhodes Island for the Security Drill, it simulates the mine area's terrain in greater detail.

lt_tr_03.name: Training Ground #10
lt_tr_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>3
A training field specially built by Rhodes Island for the Security Drill, it simulates the mine area's environment in extraordinary detail.

lt_01_01.name: Mine #5
lt_01_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>0
A small group of engineers of unknown origin have hidden themselves in the abandoned mine. Upon discovery by picket officers, both sides fell into conflict, hindering the cleanup of the mine.

lt_01_02.name: Mercenary
lt_01_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>1
Several infamous mining contractors found themselves chased out of Siesta after multiple violations the Obsidian trading laws. Apparently they haven't learned anything from the debacle though, as they plot to continue their actions elsewhere.

lt_01_03.name: Evil Forces
lt_01_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>2
The local gangs and scoundrels seem to have their eye on the mine, regularly coming over to 'see what they can help with.' These people are harder to shake off than a hound.

lt_01_04.name: Ineffectual Organization
lt_01_04.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>3
The scattered rioters appear strangely used to acting as an organization. They've somehow acquired Reunion uniforms and have begun acting as such. Their by-laws? Nothing but destruction.

lt_01_05.name: Sand Beast Cave
lt_01_05.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>4
A group of exiled mercenaries have taken to using the place as a ranch. The sand beasts feed on the mutated Originium slugs, and often race about the mine in excitement after a meal.

lt_01_06.name: Equipment Acceptance Testing
lt_01_06.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>5
The mine has just purchased a new batch of vehicles from another city, intending to modify them for mineral transport. The docking process was rather smooth, until people broke into the final acceptance testing site.

lt_01_07.name: Secret Base
lt_01_07.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>6
Defender Elites dig to expand the available space, while engineers take apart and reassemble the existing electrical equipment. These rioters disguised as Reunion have unscrupulously taken over the mine and are preparing to convert it into a secret base.

lt_01_08.name: Nature's Premature Death
lt_01_08.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>7
An eye opens in the darkness, slag falling from its eyelid like a inky black waterfall. It has always lived in the depths of this mine. Is it a creature nurtured by nature, or a victim of the steady progress of civilization?

lt_02_01.name: Good Neighbor
lt_02_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>0
During the mine's inactivity, the neighboring forest farm has 'legally' expanded its territory. You approach them to get in touch, but their patrol hounds and security personnel are not particularly welcoming.

lt_02_02.name: Groundbreaking Ceremony
lt_02_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>1
The groundbreaking ceremony's congratulatory salvo has barely faded when hordes of metal crabs and armed rioters surge in from all directions. They are almost certainly not here to celebrate.

lt_02_03.name: Wanderers' Shelter
lt_02_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>2
To these Sarkaz mercenaries who lost their home and wandered so far to get here, having their territory seized is a humiliation of the highest order. You are viewed as invaders trespassing on their domain.

lt_02_04.name: 'Arena'
lt_02_04.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>3
The local fanatics have dressed up like Kazimierz knights, shirking honest work and instead fighting each other in duels... They've set up an arena in the mine.

lt_02_05.name: Leaving Home
lt_02_05.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>4
After leaving their homes in search of better job opportunities, these Tiacauh Warriors and Shieldguards were hired to 'fight evil' at the mine. They've obviously been taken for a ride.

lt_02_06.name: Originium Pollution
lt_02_06.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>5
The mine once accidentally unearthed an Originium Slug nest, resulting in serious contamination of the site. Now, the cleanup has once again disturbed those same Infected creatures, as they rush to the surface in a bid to escape to the wilderness.

lt_02_07.name: Vicious Competition
lt_02_07.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>6
A large number of mercenaries and wandering Infected have rushed into the mine and are sowing chaos in an organized manner. Upon investigation, it appears they were hired by a competing miners in the same city.

lt_02_08.name: Unto the Breach
lt_02_08.desc:
<@lv.fs>Starting Danger Level:</>7
A gigantic creature of unknown origin tears through the earth and rocks as gang members and thugs gather around it, rapidly approaching the recently cleaned up mining site together. Is it under the control of these villains, or is it spurring them on?

lt_03_01.name: Right of Way
lt_03_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>0
A group of armed engineers claim that the mining platform is in their way. They demand that it move aside, or allow them to pass through it.

lt_03_02.name: Coming Prepared
lt_03_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>1
Members in heavy equipment draw attention while their allies penetrate the defense line into the mining layer. These people came prepared.

lt_03_03.name: Organized Ranks
lt_03_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>2
There was a misunderstanding between the engineers and the Shieldguard. The warriors who broke away from Reunion have not lost their way: they remain organized and disciplined, defending Ursus in their own way.

lt_03_04.name: 'Ursus Tournament'
lt_03_04.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>3
The insurgents have obtained the gear of Kazimierz Knightclubs. The rules of the tournament have been simplified: lives equal points. The faint-of-heart are relegated to the spectator stands. The restoration of the mining platform seems to have interrupted their 'tournament.'

lt_03_05.name: 'Undisciplined Rabble'
lt_03_05.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>4
Bouncers, thugs, vagrants... vagabonds of all sorts come looking for trouble as the cleanup continues. Seems like this is about more than just protection money.

lt_03_06.name: Engineering Checkup
lt_03_06.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>5
As the mining platform links up with the nomadic city for maintenance, militants disguised as engineers sabotage the platform under the cover of drones.

lt_03_07.name: Sudden Visit
lt_03_07.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>6
A group claiming to be Ursus military tries to shut down the mining platform, saying that they received a tip-off regarding Reunion remnants in the area. They have not been able to present proper identification, however.

lt_03_08.name: Long Journey
lt_03_08.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>7
It climbs out slowly, wearing its massive 'hut' on its back and leaving a trail of glowing lights behind, illuminating the dark underground world. There was a plan in place to relocate it, but unexpected interference has complicated things.

lt_04_01.name: Serendipity
lt_04_01.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>0
Słoma Foods originally touted knight tournaments as one of the perks of working on its platforms, but few knights are willing to fight in such tiny arenas. Ironically, it is now inhabited by those who are down on their luck since the platform's abandonment.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

lt_04_02.name: True or False
lt_04_02.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>1
There have been many sightings of Brassrust since his disappearance, but all have turned out to be imitators. This one should be no exception.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

lt_04_03.name: Gentle Nights
lt_04_03.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>2
The neon lights of the city struggle to illuminate the deeply-rooted darkness. The light of a candle may be able to do so... or maybe not.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

lt_04_04.name: Rock and a Hard Place
lt_04_04.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>3
Retired competition knights usually fade into obscurity, though there are always some fans who never forget―not necessarily to the benefit of the knights themselves.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

lt_04_05.name: Battered Branches
lt_04_05.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>4
It is a massive labyrinth within the food processing platform. Even twins may lose sight of each other.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

lt_04_06.name: Journey's Rest
lt_04_06.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>5
'Civilization' is everywhere in Kazimierz. The more you scorn it, the closer it creeps.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

lt_04_07.name: Scattered Dirt
lt_04_07.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>6
Goods are chosen, goods are made, goods are thrown away. Neither the production line nor the goods need subjectivity.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

lt_04_08.name: Bottomless Pit
lt_04_08.desc:
<@lv.fs>Initial Danger: </>7
Pincers used for fighting have degenerated, while its mouthparts have been twisted into tentacles. The mutations brought on by consuming too much industrial material have made this Gloompincer unrecognizable in both form and behavior, a mouth that is constantly trying to fill its insatiable stomach.
<@lv.item><Nightfall></> Operators cannot be deployed on tiles where you do not have visibility. Enemies in areas without visibility are treated as Invisible.

tatical_pioneer_01.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+20%</> ATK and <@ba.vup>+1</> SP every 3 seconds

tatical_pioneer_02.desc: Converts all Tactical Equipment to Transfer Permits (<@ba.vup>10</> per equipment)

tatical_warrior_02.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+20%</> ATK and <@ba.vup>+20</> ASPD

tatical_tank_01.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+40%</> DEF and <@ba.vup>+1</> Block

tatical_tank_02.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+25%</> DEF and <@ba.vup>+25%</> Max HP

tatical_sniper_02.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+25%</> ATK and <@ba.vup>+25%</> Max HP

tatical_caster_01.desc: Grants the relieving Operator <@ba.vup>+20%</> ATK and <@ba.vup>+1</> SP every 3 seconds

tatical_support_02.desc: After deployment, view <@ba.vup>4</> random Operators in the Preparation Area, and choose <@ba.vup>1</> of them to transfer

tatical_medic_02.desc: After deployment, <@ba.vup>revive</> a <@ba.vup>downed Operator</> within range

tatical_special_01.desc: After deployment, return retreated Operators to the <@ba.vup>Deployment Waiting Zone</>, and redeployment time <@ba.vup>-50%</>

tatical_special_02.desc: Grants the relieving operator <@ba.vup>+20</> ASPD and <@ba.vup>+1</> SP every 3 seconds

detailConst.firstClearTaskDesc: Clear up to Phase {0} in a single attempt
